name: Azimaet Drake

name: Azorius Aethermage
text: Whenever a permanent is returned to your hand, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: In her single metasphere are bound the records of every Ætheric transaction since the time of Azor.

name: Azorius Æthermage
text: Whenever a permanent is returned to your hand, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: In her single metasphere are bound the records of every Ætheric transaction since the time of Azor.

name: Azorius Arrester
text: When Azorius Arrester enters the battlefield, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

editions.flavor: "You have the right to remain silent. Mostly because I tire of your excuses."

name: Azorius Chancery
text:
Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield tapped.
When Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.

name: Azorius Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn.
• Draw a card.
• Put target attacking or blocking creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"The rules of logic and order have already made the choice for you."
—Isperia

name: Azorius Cluestone
text:
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Azorius Cluestone: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Its three sides represent the Sova, judges and arbitrators; the Jelenn, scribes and elocutors; and the Lyev, lawmages and enforcers.

name: Azorius First-Wing
text: Flying, protection from enchantments

editions.flavor: With a steady diet of lawbreakers, Azorius griffins inevitably develop a resistance to the contraband magic that taints much of their prey.

name: Azorius Guildgate
text:
Azorius Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

name: Azor's Elocutors
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a filibuster counter on Azor's Elocutors. Then if Azor's Elocutors has five or more filibuster counters on it, you win the game.
Whenever a source deals damage to you, remove a filibuster counter from Azor's Elocutors.

name: Azure Drake
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The Azure Drake would be more powerful were it not so easily distracted.

Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.
More so than "storm" or "pirate," "drake" is the word a sailor least wants to hear.

Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

name: Azure Mage
text: {3}{U}: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:

—Azure creed

—Azure creed

"We draw our power from the infinite ocean of the mind, where all manner of things can be conceived."

name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
text: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.

editions.flavor: "I do not miss Jukai Forest. It is not my home. My home is Kamigawa, its people my family. Wherever I set my pack and rest my head, I am home."

name: Backdraft
text: Choose a player who cast one or more sorcery spells this turn. Backdraft deals damage to that player equal to half the damage dealt by one of those sorcery spells this turn, rounded down.

name: Backfire
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to you, Backfire deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

name: Back from the Brink
text: Exile a creature card from your graveyard and pay its mana cost: Create a token that's a copy of that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: On Innistrad, death is just a career change.

name: Backlash
text: Tap target untapped creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to its controller.

editions.flavor: Darigaaz decided his foe would be more useful as a weapon.

name: Backslide
text:
Turn target creature with a morph ability face down.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: Some things are better left unknown.

name: Back to Basics
text: Nonbasic lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor:
"A ruler wears a crown while the rest of us wear hats, but which would you rather have when it's raining?"
—Barrin, Principia

name: Back to Nature
text: Destroy all enchantments.

editions.flavor:
"Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, Essays
There will always be those who presume to improve nature, or dare to befoul it. And nature will always have a response.

name: Backup Plan
text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
Draw an additional hand of seven cards as the game begins. Before taking mulligans, shuffle all but one of your hands into your library.

editions.flavor: "In the market for an alternative, friend?"

name: Backwoods Survivalists
text: Delirium — Backwoods Survivalists gets +1/+1 and has trample as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Paranoia has driven some Kessig communities to hunt down anything—and anyone—that travels through their woods.

text: {1}{B}, Growl: Regenerate Bad Ass.

editions.flavor: He wanders the land in search of Good Ass.

name: Bala Ged Thief
text: Whenever Bala Ged Thief or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, target player reveals a number of cards from his or her hand equal to the number of Allies you control. You choose one of them. That player discards that card.

name: Balance
text: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

name: Balance of Power
text: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.

editions.flavor:
"To empty your mind is to fill your grave."
—Lat-Nam teaching

name: Balancing Act
text: Each player chooses a number of permanents he or she controls equal to the number of permanents controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Each player discards cards the same way.

editions.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an ‘amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

name: Banshee of the Dread Choir
text:
Myriad (Whenever this creature attacks, for each opponent other than defending player, you may create a token that's a copy of this creature that's tapped and attacking that player or a planeswalker he or she controls. Exile the tokens at end of combat.)
Whenever Banshee of the Dread Choir deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

name: Banshee's Blade
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each charge counter on Banshee's Blade.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage, put a charge counter on Banshee's Blade.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Bant
text:
All creatures have exalted. (Whenever a creature attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each instance of exalted among permanents its controller controls.)
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, put a divinity counter on target green, white, or blue creature. That creature has indestructible for as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
